name: Large-leaf Pondweed

Identifying Characteristics: Leaves: large stipules that taper to sharp point, Submersed - broad (3-7cm wide), green, alternative arrangement, many veins, arched, outer margins folding slightly toward one another at midrib, have petioles (1-6cm); floating â€“ oval shaped (2.5-5cm wide), opposite arrangement near top of plant, have long petioles (up to 30cm)
Flowers: midsummer, small, 4 petal-like lobes on long (5cm) spike rising above water
Fruits/Seeds: late summer, oval to egg shaped with small beak
Range: Native Range: Maine, New England, much of United States
